sentence:
…colleagues  are now saying: Yes, we should separate this out. Yes, I don't want to  defend DHS and ICE and have the government shut down because I will  just salute the President.

They understand, and I give them credit. I will take any millimeters  of bravery that I can get from the other side of the aisle to say: This  is not America.

And you better believe…

…made it perfectly clear to the President that this won't happen.  Someone has to stand up to him.

He wants to take Greenland. He wants to make Gaza a resort. The  President has to understand that he is not a king. He is not the  emperor. He is not a dictator. He has awesome power, but he doesn't  have the power to just go around people and take what…
Mr. MORENO. Mr. President, I understand that there is a bill at the  desk, and I ask for its first reading.

Mr. THUNE. Mr. President, I understand the Senate received H.J. Res.  87 from the House.

Mr. THUNE.  Res. 87.
Mr. THUNE. Mr. President, I understand there is a bill at the desk  due a second reading.

…consideration; that the bill be considered read a  third time and passed; and that the motion to reconsider be considered  made and laid upon the table.

Mr. COONS. Mr. President, I understand that Senator Crapo, the  chairman of the Finance Committee, a supporter of President Trump, has  blocked this bill today. I hope to find ways to work with him on…
Mr. CORNYN. Mr. President, I understand there is a bill at the desk,  and I ask for its first reading.

Mr. THUNE. Mr. President, I understand there is a bill at the desk,  and I ask for its first reading.
